{{location infobox | name=Firth of Drengist | image=Peter Xavier Price - Traces of the Noldor.jpg | caption=''Traces of the Noldor'' by [[Peter Xavier Price]] | pronun= | othernames=Drengist | location=Northwestern [[Beleriand]], North of [[Nevrast]], [[Ered Lómin]], [[Cirith Ninniach]] | type=Firth | description=Narrow inlet from [[Belegaer]] into [[Beleriand]] | regions= | towns= | inhabitants= | created= | destroyed= | events={{YT|1497}}: Arrival of the host of Fëanor in [[Middle-earth]]
{{FA|155}}: Morgoth's [[Assaults on Hithlum]] }} The '''Firth of Drengist''', or just '''Drengist''', was a firth in [[Beleriand]]. The [[Belegaer]] broke through the [[Ered Lómin]] and ended in the [[Cirith Ninniach]]. The lands it separated were [[Lammoth]] to the north, and [[Nevrast]] to the south.{{S|Map}} Outside the firth was the little-known island of [[Ened]]. ==History== [[Fëanor]] and the [[Noldor]] landed at the Firth of Drengist, and their ships were burned at [[Losgar]], which was located at the outlet of the bay.{{S|9}} From there, Fëanor and his host pierced into [[Hithlum]].{{S|13}} Years later, the first of [[Morgoth]]'s [[Assaults on Hithlum]] was countered here by [[Fingolfin]], driving the Orcs into the sea.{{S|13}}{{GA|115}} ==Etymology== In an early manuscript by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]], ''Drengist'' is glossed as the [[Elvish]] equivalent of [[Old English]] ''Nearufléot''. The latter name is said by [[Christopher Tolkien]] to consist of ''[[Wiktionary:nearu|nearu]]'' ("narrow") + ''[[Wiktionary:fleet#English|fléot]]'' ("arm of the sea, estuary, firth").{{SM|QA1}}, p. 210 The Elvish etymology of the name ''Drengist'' itself, however, appears to have been nowhere explained by Tolkien. {{references}} [[Category:Bays]] [[Category:Beleriand]] [[Category:Noldorin locations]] [[Category:Sindarin locations]] [[de:Drengist]] [[fr:encyclo:geographie:eaux:beleriand:drengist]] [[fi:Drengist]]
